Tom,

These are the seller's photos, which are better than the ones I took myself, except for cutting off part of it once.

 I'm probably misusing the term shakudo.  Perhaps it's "melted-on something-or-other zogan."   The tsuba is definitely old.  I do own a nice collection of Tokyo Planning Office beer coasters and paperweights, all made last week.    

David 


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: tom helm 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, July 12, 2005 9:08 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] tsuba school


  David-
        sorry to say this looks modern to my eye, (maybe the photos), 
  I am no tsuba guy but have never heard of melted shakudo. This looks 
  like a modern attempt at aging or perhaps they were shooting for 
  sahari. What does the color inside the hitsu look like?
  -t
